column3: is a city located in the northeastern part of the state of Guanajuato in Mexico. San Luis de la Paz was founded on August 25
column5: as a defensive town on the Spanish Silver Road
column6: which linked the Zacatecas mines with Mexico City during the Spanish domination. It owes its name to the peace treaty between Otomi Indians
column9: on the day of Saint Louis of France
column10: August 25. San Luis de la Paz is also known as the Chichimeca Nation.

column1: The municipality lies adjacent to the southern border of the state of San Luis Potosi. The city serves as the seat of the municipality. At the Mexican census of 2009
column2: the city had a population of 109
column3: 000 inhabitants. The municipality has an area of 2
column4: 030.14 km² (783.84 sq mi). Its largest other community is the town of Misión de Chichimecas.

San Luis de la Paz is surrounded by many mountains and rock formations
column2: like the Bernalejo hill and the Bridge of God.The Paso de Vaqueros Canyon is 30 minutes outside the town of San Luis de la Paz. The Manzanares and San Juan Rivers are inside the canyon. Paso de Vaqueros is sought for rappelling

column1: San Luis de la Paz is considered to be the most important agricultural and commercial area of the Sierra Gorda (northeast zone) in the state of Guanajuato. Furthermore
column2: it is also considered an ideal location to set up manufacturing firms.
